case_vignette:
A 29-year-old woman comes to the office with the complaints of severe bleeding after a dental extraction which required local hemostatic therapy. She has a long-term excessive menstrual bleeding and iron-deficiency anemia that required treatment with iron supplement since the age of 17. In addition, she states that her mother also has a history of frequent nosebleeds. The vital signs include: pulse rate 107/min, respiratory rate 17/min, temperature 37.2°C (99.0°F), and blood pressure 90/60 mm Hg. Her physical exam shows generalized pallor.
The complete blood count results are as follows:
Hemoglobin 10.7 g/dL
Hematocrit 41%
Leukocyte count 8,000/mm3
Neutrophils 54%
Bands 3%
Eosinophils 1%
Basophils 0%
Lymphocytes 32%
Monocytes 2%
Mean corpuscular hemoglobin 25.4 pg/cell
Mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration 31% Hb/cell
Mean corpuscular volume 76 μm3
Platelet count 380,000/mm³
The coagulation test results are as follows:
Partial thromboplastin time (activated) 48.0 s
Prothrombin time 14.0 s
International normalized ratio 0.9
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Hematology and Oncology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing severe bleeding after having a tooth pulled out, and I've had long-term heavy periods since I was 17.
Do you have any known bleeding disorders in your family history?
Yes, my mother has a history of frequent nosebleeds.
Have you ever had any episodes of spontaneous bleeding or bruising with minimal or no trauma?
No, I have not mentioned any spontaneous bleeding or bruising.
Have you or your mother ever been diagnosed with a bleeding disorder?
I haven't stated whether my mother or I have been officially diagnosed with a bleeding disorder.
Has your mother or anyone else in your family been diagnosed with a specific medical condition related to bleeding?
I only mentioned that my mother has a history of frequent nosebleeds, but I didn't specify any diagnosis.
Have you had any blood work done recently, and if so, what were the results?
Yes, I've had blood work done; my hemoglobin was 10.7, and I had some other values like a platelet count of 380,000 and a prolonged partial thromboplastin time of 48.0 seconds.
Have you been examined or treated by a hematologist for your bleeding symptoms?
I have not mentioned seeing a hematologist or receiving any specific treatment from one for my bleeding symptoms.
Given your symptoms of prolonged bleeding, heavy menstrual periods, and a prolonged partial thromboplastin time, do you bruise easily or have a history of frequent nosebleeds like your mother?
I haven't mentioned experiencing easy bruising or having frequent nosebleeds myself.
Have you ever had surgery before, and if so, did you experience any abnormal bleeding during or after the procedure?
I have not mentioned having any surgery before.
Do you experience any joint pain or have had any episodes of bleeding into your joints?
No, I have not mentioned experiencing joint pain or bleeding into my joints.
Are you currently taking any medications or supplements, particularly those that could affect bleeding, such as aspirin, NSAIDs, or anticoagulants?
I am currently taking iron supplements.
Have you or your mother ever been tested for clotting factor levels or had any genetic testing for bleeding disorders?
I have not mentioned any testing for clotting factor levels or genetic testing for bleeding disorders for either my mother or myself.
Have your heavy periods ever required medical intervention such as iron transfusions or hormonal treatments?
Yes, I have been treated with iron supplements since I was 17.
Final Diagnosis: Von Willebrand Disease
